titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tramcar Company Ledger WAG.296

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:03:57 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This handwritten ledger (1889-1892) belonging to an unidentified tramcar company (whose President is noted as Mr. Thompson) provides information about tramcar workers employed by an unidentified company in New York City including names, rates of pay, and reasons for discharge. Some discharges are associated with a strike on January 29, 1889.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Bill Nash, 2006. The accession number associated with this gift is 2005.029.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 120 years after their date of creation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tramcar Company Ledger; WAG 296; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
